wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the system overview focused on the Slimy Monorepo platform. Explain its purpose as a full-stack Discord bot ecosystem with administrative interfaces, data processing pipelines, and public web services. Document the high-level architecture including the interaction between admin-api, admin-ui, bot, and web applications. Describe the monorepo structure using pnpm workspaces and how shared packages enable code reuse. Illustrate the data flow from Discord events through backend processing to frontend presentation. Include deployment topology using Docker and Docker Compose. Provide context for developers on how components integrate and the overall system boundaries. Address key design decisions such as the API Gateway pattern through admin-api and separation of concerns across services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Discord Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Discord integration layer of the bot service. Explain how discord.js is initialized and configured, including client instantiation, gateway intents, and event registration. Document the connection lifecycle, reconnection strategies, and session management with Discord's API. Describe how the bot handles authentication tokens and permissions. Cover best practices for managing bot presence, activity status, and shard configuration if applicable. Include examples of event subscription patterns and demonstrate how the bot listens to core Discord events such as message creation, guild joins, and interactions. Address rate limiting considerations, API error handling, and compliance with Discord's Developer Terms of Service.

wiki_catalogs.name: Web Application
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the public web application built on Next.js 16. Describe the App Router architecture, React Server Components implementation, and routing structure. Document the layout system with RootLayout and AppShell components. Explain the authentication flow using AuthProvider and error handling with AuthErrorBoundary. Cover the lazy loading strategy using lazyLoadHeavy and lazyLoadSSR functions for bundle optimization. Detail the responsive design implementation using Tailwind CSS and the service worker registration for offline capabilities. Include performance optimization techniques such as route prefetching, code splitting, and image optimization with next/image.

wiki_catalogs.name: Express Application Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Express.js application structure in the admin-api service. Describe the middleware layers including security, authentication, rate limiting, and error handling. Explain the routing system with route organization and mounting patterns. Document the service module integration and request flow from entry point to business logic. Include details on the application initialization process, server configuration, and graceful shutdown implementation. Provide examples from the actual codebase showing middleware composition and route registration. Address performance considerations and security measures implemented at the application level.

wiki_catalogs.name: BullMQ Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the BullMQ configuration focused on Redis integration and queue initialization. Explain how queues are instantiated using ioredis connections, the role of the QueueManager in centralizing queue access, and connection pooling strategies. Document configuration options such as prefixing, default job options, and rate limiting. Include code examples showing queue creation, worker registration, and event listeners for completed/failed jobs. Describe how environment variables influence queue behavior and Redis connection settings. Address best practices for connection resilience and handling Redis outages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Authentication Package
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the shared-auth package focused on centralized authentication logic across the Slimy Monorepo. Document its export interfaces including JWT utilities, session validation, and OAuth helpers. Explain how it is consumed by admin-api, web, and admin-ui for consistent authentication behavior. Detail integration patterns with Express middleware and Next.js API routes. Include examples of token generation, verification, and error handling from actual usage in admin-api/src/middleware/auth.js and web/lib/auth/. Address versioning strategy, backward compatibility considerations, and testing practices for changes to this critical shared component. Provide guidance on extending authentication methods and securing token flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Tracking with Sentry
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for error tracking focused on Sentry integration in the Slimy Monorepo. Explain how unhandled exceptions and promise rejections are captured across the admin-api service. Document the configuration of Sentry SDK with Express middleware, including request context enrichment with user, transaction, and custom tags. Detail the integration with logging via the logger.js module and correlation of errors with request IDs. Describe how different services (admin-api, web, bot) report errors to centralized Sentry. Include code examples from auth middleware and route handlers showing error capture patterns. Address sampling strategies, source map upload process, and environment-based filtering. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like missing stack traces or rate limiting.

wiki_catalogs.name: CI Workflow Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the GitHub Actions CI workflow. Detail the pipeline stages including code checkout, dependency installation with pnpm, environment setup, and test execution. Explain the matrix strategy for testing across Node.js versions. Document the build process for the Next.js application and Docker image creation. Include caching mechanisms for dependencies and artifacts. Describe the integration with Playwright for end-to-end testing and how test results are reported. Provide guidance on troubleshooting failed workflows and best practices for extending the CI configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Docker Containerization Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Docker containerization strategy focused on the multi-stage build process and service isolation. Describe the base, deps, builder, and runner stages in the Dockerfile, explaining how dependencies are optimized and security is enhanced through user permissions. Document the service definitions in docker-compose files, including network isolation using custom bridge networks, health checks, and restart policies. Explain the volume mounting strategy for data persistence and development synchronization. Include environment variable injection patterns and build-time argument usage for configuration flexibility. Address image optimization techniques and security considerations in the container build process.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Next.js App Router routing system. Explain the file-based routing structure with route handlers in the app directory. Document the middleware implementation for authentication checks and route protection. Detail the matcher configuration that excludes API routes and static assets from authentication middleware. Describe the layout system with RootLayout and nested layouts for different sections. Include examples of dynamic routes using [id] parameters and API route integrations. Explain the relationship between client-side navigation and server-side route handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the session management system in the admin-ui application. Explain the implementation of the SessionProvider context for managing user authentication state across the application. Document the token handling, session persistence, and refresh mechanisms. Include examples of how authentication state is synchronized between UI components and protected routes. Describe integration with the admin-api's JWT-based authentication system and OAuth flow. Address common issues such as session expiration, token invalidation, and error handling during login flows. Provide guidance on extending the session system with additional identity providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Prisma Client Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Prisma client configuration system. Describe the singleton pattern implementation across development and production environments, including the use of global variables to prevent multiple instances during hot reload. Document the connection initialization process, logging configuration based on environment, and middleware integration for query metrics. Explain the connection pooling strategy, error handling during initialization, and graceful disconnection procedures. Include code examples showing client instantiation, health checks, and connection testing. Address performance implications of logging in development versus production and the impact of middleware on query latency.

wiki_catalogs.name: DiagWidget
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the DiagWidget component in the admin-ui application. Explain its purpose in displaying system diagnostics and health metrics, including how it fetches and visualizes data from the admin-api diagnostics endpoints. Document component props, internal state management, and integration with real-time data sources via socket connections. Include usage examples from actual implementation in the guild diagnostics pages. Describe UI behavior under different system states (loading, error, normal operation) and accessibility features. Address responsive design considerations and performance optimization for frequent data updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the authentication endpoints in the admin-api service. Document the OAuth flow initiation at GET /api/auth/login, callback handling at GET /api/auth/callback, current user retrieval at GET /api/auth/me, and session clearing at POST /api/auth/logout. For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request parameters, headers, and body structures. Detail the JWT-based authentication mechanism, session management using Redis, and token refresh strategies. Include request/response schemas with example payloads for both success and error cases. Explain CSRF protection measures and rate limiting policies applied to authentication endpoints. Provide usage examples for common authentication workflows and integration patterns with the admin-ui and web applications. Address security considerations including token expiration, secure cookie handling, and protection against common vulnerabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Club Data Retrieval
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the club data retrieval endpoint GET /api/guilds/:guildId/club/latest. Detail the request structure, including required path parameter guildId and authentication via JWT. Document the successful response schema containing club metrics for all members, including fields such as userId, displayName, snailCount, and activityScore. Include error responses for invalid guild IDs, unauthorized access, and backend service failures. Explain the data flow from the web application's Next.js API route through the adminApiClient proxy to the admin-api service. Provide code examples for frontend consumption using the club API client. Address caching behavior with edge runtime and revalidation every 30 seconds. Discuss performance implications for large guilds and the use of database indexing in the underlying club-store query.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conversation Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the conversation management endpoints in the chat service. Document the GET /api/chat/conversations endpoint for listing user-accessible conversations with pagination support and role-based filtering. Detail the POST /api/chat/conversations endpoint for creating new conversations, including validation of initial metadata like topic, personality mode, and access controls. Explain the GET /api/chat/conversations/:id endpoint for retrieving specific conversation details and the DELETE /api/chat/conversations/:id endpoint for archival with soft-delete semantics. Specify request/response schemas with example payloads showing conversation metadata structure, including participant lists, creation timestamps, and configuration settings. Describe the integration between the web application's chat interface and these endpoints for conversation lifecycle management. Include information on error handling for unauthorized access attempts and rate limiting policies applied to creation requests. Provide usage examples demonstrating common workflows such as starting a new conversation and resuming previous discussions.

wiki_catalogs.name: List Guilds Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the GET /api/guilds endpoint. Document the purpose of listing guilds where the authenticated user has access and the bot is installed. Specify query parameters including 'limit', 'offset', 'search', and 'includeMembers', detailing their validation rules and default values. Describe the response structure with paginated results, including guild ID, name, icon, member count, bot installation status, and ownership information. Explain the authentication flow using JWT and role-based access control via the auth middleware. Detail how the endpoint integrates with Discord's API to verify bot presence and user permissions. Include example requests with various query parameters and corresponding success responses. Document error cases such as unauthorized access, invalid pagination parameters, and backend service failures. Address performance considerations including caching strategies in the web layer and rate limiting using the rate-limit middleware.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the technology stack focused on the Slimy Monorepo. Detail the primary technologies: Next.js 16 for the web application, Express.js for the admin-api, discord.js for the bot service, and Prisma ORM for database operations. Explain the role of TypeScript across services and JavaScript in legacy modules. Document the testing stack including Jest, Vitest, and Playwright for E2E testing. Cover infrastructure tools like Docker, Docker Compose, and systemd for deployment. Include monitoring solutions: Sentry for error tracking, Prometheus for metrics, Grafana for dashboards, and Alertmanager for alerts. Highlight build tools including pnpm, ESLint, and Tailwind CSS. Provide version compatibility information and rationale for technology choices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Command System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the command system sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the command registration and dispatch mechanism, focusing on the pattern used in handleHealthCommand and isHealthCommand functions. Document how commands are parsed from message content, including prefix detection and case-insensitive matching. Explain the structure of command handlers, their parameters, and return types. Include concrete examples from the health command implementation showing response formatting with EmbedBuilder and permission checks using PermissionFlagsBits. Describe how command metadata (name, description, options) is organized and how user input validation is performed. Address command scope (global vs guild-specific), cooldowns, and error recovery within command execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin UI
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the admin-ui application. Describe the legacy pages directory structure and custom routing implementation. Explain the session management system using SessionProvider and the authentication flow. Document the component architecture with key UI elements like DiagWidget and RescanUploader. Cover the styling approach using global CSS files and responsive design implementation. Detail the API integration strategy for communicating with the admin-api backend. Address the differences between this React application and the Next.js web application, including hydration patterns and client-side rendering considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Prisma ORM database layer. Detail the entity relationships between Guild, User, Session, AuditLog, ClubData, and ChatConversation models. Document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints. Explain the migration strategy and version control process. Include database schema diagrams and sample data. Document data access patterns, connection pooling, and performance considerations. Address data validation rules, business logic enforcement, and transaction management. Provide examples of complex queries and their optimization techniques. Include data lifecycle management and retention policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Processor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the audit-processor job type. Explain its responsibility in logging system events, security-critical actions, and user activities to audit trails. Document the data structure of audit jobs, including action type, target resource, user context, and metadata. Describe how the processor integrates with the logging system and database layer to ensure durable storage. Include examples of audit events such as configuration changes, permission updates, and data exports. Explain error handling and retry logic when audit persistence fails. Address compliance considerations and retention policies enforced during processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Configuration Package
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the shared-config package focused on environment-agnostic configuration management across services. Document its role in normalizing configuration loading, validation, and access patterns for admin-api, web, and bot services. Explain integration with env-validation.js and config.js from admin-api, and how it ensures consistent environment variable handling. Cover schema definition, default values, and runtime configuration resolution. Include usage examples from apps/admin-api/src/lib/config/index.js and web/lib/config.ts. Address best practices for adding new configuration options, type safety with TypeScript, and avoiding configuration drift across services. Discuss performance implications and caching of resolved configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics Collection with Prometheus
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Prometheus metrics collection in the Slimy Monorepo. Document the implementation of custom metrics including counters, gauges, histograms, and summaries for API latency, request rates, error counts, and queue processing. Explain the integration with Express.js via middleware to track HTTP request duration and status codes. Detail metrics related to BullMQ job processors (chat-processor, audit-processor) including job completion times and failure rates. Describe the /metrics endpoint exposure and scraping configuration in prometheus.yml. Include examples of key metrics like 'http_request_duration_seconds' and 'bullmq_job_duration'. Provide guidance on adding new metrics and ensuring proper label cardinality. Address security considerations for exposing metrics endpoints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the testing strategy focused on automated testing across the codebase. Explain the configuration of Playwright for end-to-end testing, including browser contexts, test retries, and video recording. Document the test structure with unit, integration, and E2E tests using Jest, Vitest, and Playwright. Describe the testing of API routes, UI components, and user workflows. Include setup and teardown procedures, mocking strategies, and test data management. Address performance testing with Lighthouse and accessibility checks. Provide examples of common test patterns and debugging techniques for flaky tests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment-Specific Deployment Configurations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the environment-specific deployment configurations. Explain the differences between the NUC1 and NUC2 docker-compose setups, focusing on hardware-specific optimizations and service topology variations. Document the production web configuration with port mappings, environment variables, and health check parameters. Describe the service interdependencies and startup ordering using health-based conditions. Cover the database container configuration with MySQL 8, including authentication setup, volume persistence, and root password derivation. Include network configuration details for both standalone and clustered deployments. Provide guidance on adapting these configurations for different infrastructure environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the authentication system. Explain the middleware-based authentication flow that redirects unauthenticated users to the admin API login endpoint. Document the AuthProvider component that manages user session state and CSRF tokens. Describe the AuthErrorBoundary component that handles authentication-related errors with retry and navigation options. Detail the session refresh mechanism and token management. Include error handling strategies for expired sessions and failed token refreshes. Provide examples of protected route implementation and error boundary usage in components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the component architecture of the admin-ui application. Thoroughly explain the design and implementation of key UI components including DiagWidget for system diagnostics, RescanUploader for data rescan operations, CorrectionsManager for managing data corrections, and UsageDiagnosticsCard for usage analytics. Document component props, state management, and event handling patterns. Include usage examples from actual implementation and describe how these components are composed within page layouts. Explain error boundary implementation and drawer navigation pattern. Address responsive behavior and accessibility considerations for each major component.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Migrations and Schema Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the database migration system. Detail the Prisma migration workflow and version control process, including the initial migration structure and schema definitions. Document the club data schema, guild settings schema, and their relationship to the core Prisma-generated models. Explain the migration deployment process across environments and the strategy for schema evolution. Include examples of raw SQL migration files and their corresponding Prisma schema definitions. Address migration rollback procedures, schema validation techniques, and conflict resolution strategies during team development. Provide guidance on adding new migrations and verifying schema integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: RescanUploader
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the RescanUploader component in the admin-ui application. Explain its role in enabling administrators to trigger data rescan operations for guilds, including file upload handling and progress feedback. Document component props, event callbacks, and integration with the admin-api rescan endpoints. Include usage examples from the guild rescan interface, describe validation rules and error handling during upload. Address accessibility compliance, drag-and-drop interactions, and responsive behavior across device sizes. Provide guidance on extending the component for additional file types or backend integrations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Guild Management Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the guild management endpoints in the admin-api service. Document the GET /api/guilds endpoint for listing user guilds with bot installation status, including query parameters for pagination, search, and member inclusion. Detail the GET /api/guilds/:id endpoint for retrieving specific guild information with member data, POST /api/guilds for creating new guilds with validation rules, and DELETE /api/guilds/:id for removing guilds. For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, authentication requirements, and role-based access control. Explain the integration with Discord API for verifying bot installation status and the data transformation process. Include example requests and responses showing success and error scenarios. Document rate limiting policies, caching strategies in the web application layer, and error handling patterns. Address common issues such as permission errors, invalid guild IDs, and synchronization delays with Discord.

wiki_catalogs.name: Club Data Rescan
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the club data rescan endpoint POST /api/guilds/:guildId/club/rescan. Document the asynchronous job initiation process, including request authentication, validation of guild membership, and queuing via BullMQ's database-processor. Detail the response format with job ID and status fields, enabling clients to poll for completion. Explain the backend processing pipeline: data ingestion from external sources (e.g., spreadsheets), parsing with club-ingest.js, validation against club-schema.sql, and storage updates via club-store.js. Include error handling for failed jobs, such as network issues or malformed data, and describe how these are logged and surfaced to administrators. Provide usage examples for triggering rescans and monitoring job progress. Address rate limiting to prevent abuse and performance considerations for resource-intensive reprocessing tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Message Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the message operations in the chat service. Detail the GET /api/chat/messages endpoint for retrieving message history within a conversation, including query parameters for pagination (limit, offset), timestamp-based filtering, and search functionality. Document the POST /api/chat/messages endpoint for submitting new messages with validation of content length, media attachments, and proper conversation context. Explain the message processing pipeline from API ingestion through the BullMQ job queue to persistence and real-time distribution. Specify request/response schemas with examples of message payloads, including sender metadata, timestamps, message type flags, and processed content. Describe the role of the chat-processor job in handling message enrichment, moderation checks, and AI response generation. Include information on rate limiting implementation to prevent spam and abuse, as well as error handling for invalid message content or unauthorized access attempts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Retrieve Guild Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the GET /api/guilds/:id endpoint. Explain its purpose in retrieving detailed information about a specific guild, including metadata, member list, and configuration settings. Specify the ':id' path parameter validation using nanoid format and error handling for invalid or non-existent guild IDs. Detail the response schema including guild name, description, member count, roles, channels, and bot permissions. Describe the integration with Discord API for real-time member data synchronization and status verification. Document authentication requirements using JWT and RBAC middleware to ensure user has sufficient permissions. Include example requests and responses showing successful retrieval and error scenarios such as 403 Forbidden or 404 Not Found. Address caching behavior in the frontend application, rate limiting policies, and potential latency issues when syncing with external Discord services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure Breakdown
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the directory structure breakdown focused on the Slimy Monorepo organization. Explain the purpose of each top-level directory: apps/ containing all services, packages/ for shared code, infra/docker/ for infrastructure, and scripts/ for utilities. Detail the internal structure of each application: admin-api with Express.js architecture, admin-ui with React components, bot with discord.js commands, and web with Next.js app directory. Map entry points for each service and describe how configuration files like Dockerfiles and docker-compose.yml orchestrate the system. Illustrate how pnpm workspaces enable dependency management across the monorepo. Provide navigation guidance for developers new to the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the event handling sub-component. Explain the implementation of safeHandler wrappers for async event processing, including error containment and automatic context extraction from Discord.js objects (guildId, userId, channelId). Document the difference between async and synchronous handler wrappers and when each should be used. Describe how events are routed from the Discord gateway to appropriate handlers through the client.on() listeners. Include examples from the index.ts file showing messageCreate and clientReady event subscriptions. Explain the error propagation mechanism, logging integration, and how unhandled exceptions are prevented from crashing the bot process. Address performance implications of event handler design and memory leak prevention strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the component architecture across both frontend applications. Describe the design system implementation with reusable UI components in the web application's components/ui directory. Document the layout components like AppShell, Header, and Footer that provide consistent application structure. Explain the error boundary pattern using AuthErrorBoundary for graceful error handling. Cover the widget components like SlimeChatWidget that provide interactive functionality. Include guidelines for component composition, props patterns, and state management. Address accessibility considerations and responsive behavior across different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the authentication flow using Discord OAuth2 and JWT tokens. Explain the complete OAuth2 authorization code flow from login initiation to token exchange. Document the JWT token creation, signing, and verification process. Describe the session management using httpOnly cookies with proper security settings. Include the role-based access control implementation and permission levels. Provide sequence diagrams showing the authentication workflow. Document security considerations including CSRF protection, token expiration, and refresh mechanisms. Include error handling for authentication failures and edge cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chat Processor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the chat-processor job type. Explain its role in handling asynchronous chat message processing, including AI model interactions via OpenAI, message enrichment, and response generation. Document the job payload structure containing conversation context, user input, and personality settings. Describe integration with the usage tracking system to monitor API consumption and enforce rate limits. Illustrate how the processor manages timeouts, handles model errors, and implements fallback responses. Provide code examples showing job enqueueing from API routes and real-time delivery of processed messages via WebSocket or polling mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Database Utilities Package
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the shared-db package focused on unified database access and Prisma ORM integration across the monorepo. Document its export of Prisma client instances, connection pooling configuration, and transaction management utilities. Explain how it supports admin-api's data operations and web application queries while ensuring consistent schema migrations via Prisma. Detail integration with database.js files in admin-api and web/lib/db.ts. Include examples of query patterns, error handling for database connectivity issues, and performance optimization techniques like indexing and query batching. Address migration workflows, version compatibility with Prisma, and testing strategies using test databases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Grafana Dashboards
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Grafana dashboards used in system monitoring. Analyze the provided grafana-dashboard.json to document key visualizations for API performance (latency, throughput, error rates), database health, Redis cache metrics, and job queue backlogs. Explain the dashboard provisioning process through dashboard.yml and datasource configuration. Detail how panels correlate data from Prometheus metrics such as HTTP request durations, queue processing times, and system resource usage. Describe the significance of each panel including error rate alerts, P95/P99 latency trends, and active job monitoring. Provide guidance on importing, customizing, and creating new dashboards. Include best practices for dashboard sharing and version control.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Automation Scripts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the deployment automation scripts. Explain the functionality of deploy-to-server.sh in orchestrating production deployments, including service stopping, image pulling, and container restart. Document environment variable handling, rollback procedures, and deployment verification steps. Describe integration with Docker Compose for multi-service coordination. Include security considerations for script execution and access control. Provide usage examples and error handling strategies. Address logging and monitoring during deployment events and how to customize the script for different environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reverse Proxy and SSL Termination
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the reverse proxy configuration using Caddy. Document the Caddyfile structure that handles both API routing and web application proxying, including the domain-specific configuration for admin.slimyai.xyz. Explain the reverse_proxy directives that forward /api/* requests to the admin API on port 3080 and all other requests to the web application on port 3001. Detail the SSL/TLS termination process with automatic certificate management. Cover the security headers implementation (HSTS, XSS protection, frame options) and their role in protecting against common web vulnerabilities. Include logging configuration and compression settings. Explain how the deploy-to-server.sh script automates Caddy configuration updates and service reloading.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the performance optimization strategies. Detail the lazy loading implementation using lazyLoad and lazyLoadHeavy functions for code splitting. Explain the performance monitoring system that tracks Core Web Vitals (CLS, FID, FCP, LCP) and navigation timing metrics. Document the service worker registration for offline capabilities and resource caching. Describe the component-level performance measurement using usePerformanceMonitoring hook and measureRenderTime function. Include bundle optimization techniques and periodic metrics reporting to monitoring endpoints.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the API integration strategy in the admin-ui application. Document the implementation of the API client library for communicating with the admin-api backend service. Explain request/response handling, error propagation, and retry mechanisms. Cover the WebSocket integration for real-time updates and task status monitoring. Detail the API endpoints consumed by the admin interface including diagnostics, guild management, and task operations. Include examples of API usage patterns from components like DiagWidget and RescanUploader. Address authentication header injection, rate limiting considerations, and response caching strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Guild Data Model and Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Guild entity and its related operations. Detail the entity structure including fields, data types, primary keys, and constraints. Document the relationships between Guild, User, and Session models through the userGuild junction table. Explain CRUD operations including findOrCreate, update, delete, and list operations with their respective query patterns. Include examples of complex queries with filtering, pagination, and search functionality. Address performance considerations for guild lookups by Discord ID versus internal ID, and optimization techniques for large guild datasets. Document transaction management for guild-related operations and data consistency requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: CorrectionsManager
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the CorrectionsManager component in the admin-ui application. Explain its function in managing data correction workflows for club data, including display of pending corrections, approval/rejection interfaces, and audit logging. Document component props, internal state logic, and API interactions with the admin-api corrections endpoints. Include usage examples from the club corrections page, describe batch operations and filtering capabilities. Address role-based access control within the UI, error handling during submission, and accessibility features for keyboard navigation and screen readers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Club Data Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the club data endpoints in the admin-api service. Document the GET /api/guilds/:guildId/club/latest endpoint for retrieving the most recent club metrics, including query parameter requirements and response structure. Detail the POST /api/guilds/:guildId/club/rescan endpoint for triggering a complete reprocessing of club data, including job queuing mechanism and response format with job status. Explain the data ingestion pipeline from external sources, validation process, and storage in the database. Include information about the club data schema, processing frequency, and error handling for failed ingestions. Document request/response schemas with example payloads, authentication requirements, and rate limiting policies. Provide usage examples for common scenarios such as displaying club metrics and troubleshooting data discrepancies. Address performance considerations for large guilds and the asynchronous nature of data updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Real-Time Communication
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the real-time communication architecture in the chat service. Explain the WebSocket-based messaging system for instant message delivery and presence updates, including connection establishment, authentication via JWT tokens, and channel subscription mechanisms. Document the message framing format used for real-time events, covering message types for new messages, typing indicators, user presence changes, and system notifications. Describe the integration between the Express.js backend and WebSocket handlers for maintaining session consistency. Detail the failover and reconnection strategies implemented in the client-side web application to ensure reliable delivery. Specify the event schema with examples of payload structures for different message types. Address performance considerations such as connection pooling, message batching, and heartbeat mechanisms. Include troubleshooting guidance for common connectivity issues and monitoring approaches for tracking real-time communication health.

wiki_catalogs.name: Create Guild Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the POST /api/guilds endpoint. Document its purpose in creating new guild configurations within the system, including validation rules for input payloads. Specify the required fields such as guild ID, name, and owner ID, and describe how they are validated against existing records and Discord API standards. Detail the authentication and authorization requirements, ensuring only users with appropriate privileges can create guilds. Explain the data flow from request reception through validation, database persistence via Prisma, and response generation. Include example payloads for valid and invalid requests, showing corresponding 201 Created and 400 Bad Request responses. Document error handling for duplicate entries, permission violations, and database constraints. Address transaction safety, rollback behavior on failure, and integration with audit logging via the audit service.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend architecture of the Slimy Monorepo. Describe the dual frontend system with the public web application built on Next.js 16 using React Server Components and the admin-ui as a separate React application. Explain the component architecture, state management patterns, and styling approach using Tailwind CSS. Document the API client integration strategy for communicating with the admin-api backend. Cover routing mechanisms in both applications, including Next.js App Router and custom routing in admin-ui. Address responsive design implementation and accessibility considerations. Include performance optimization techniques such as code splitting and image optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Health Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the health monitoring command feature. Explain the implementation of the !bothealth and !health commands, including their triggers and response formats. Document how system information is collected: uptime calculation using formatUptime function, version extraction from package.json, memory usage from Node.js heap statistics, and WebSocket ping measurement. Describe the EmbedBuilder usage for creating structured responses with fields for Status, Uptime, Version, Environment, Memory Usage, Node.js version, Guild count, and Ping. Explain the current lack of role-based access control (TODO comment) and potential security implications. Provide guidance on extending this command with additional diagnostics and integrating it with external monitoring systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the state management patterns in both frontend applications. Describe the authentication state management using React Context API with AuthProvider in the web application and SessionProvider in the admin-ui. Document the client-side state management for features like chat interactions and form handling. Explain the data fetching and caching strategies using React Query or similar patterns. Cover the integration between frontend state and backend APIs, including optimistic updates and error recovery. Include best practices for state colocation and performance optimization through memoization and selective re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public API endpoints in the admin-api service. For each endpoint group (auth, guilds, club, chat, diag), document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Include detailed descriptions of request parameters, headers, and body structures. Document success and error response formats with example payloads. Explain rate limiting policies applied to each endpoint. Provide usage examples for common operations. Address versioning strategy and deprecation policies. Include security considerations and input validation rules for each endpoint.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Processor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the database-processor job type. Explain its responsibility in executing long-running database operations such as schema migrations, bulk data imports, index optimizations, and data cleanup tasks. Document how jobs are structured to prevent transaction timeouts and maintain data consistency. Describe integration with Prisma ORM and raw SQL execution patterns for performance-critical operations. Include examples of use cases like club data ingestion and guild settings synchronization. Explain progress tracking, error recovery, and rollback procedures for failed database jobs. Address locking strategies and concurrency control during execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Codes Processing Package
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the shared-codes package focused on code ingestion, deduplication, and analysis functionality used across club data processing and snail systems. Document its core modules for source adapters (Reddit, Snelp, etc.), deduplication logic, and cache management. Explain integration with web/lib/codes/ and admin-api/lib/club-ingest.js for processing external code submissions. Include examples of refresh workflows, fallback mechanisms, and error recovery from codes-aggregator.ts and refresh.ts. Address scalability considerations for high-volume code processing, data consistency across services, and extension points for new code sources. Provide guidance on tuning deduplication thresholds and monitoring processing latency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Alerting with Alertmanager
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Alertmanager configuration and alert routing in the Slimy Monorepo. Document the alerting rules defined in alertmanager.yml including notification receivers (email, Slack), routing trees, and groupings. Explain how Prometheus alerts (e.g., high error rates, slow API responses, queue backlogs) are processed and deduplicated. Describe integration with internal alerting via the alerts.js service for custom business logic alerts. Detail silence management, alert inhibition rules, and escalation policies. Provide examples of real alert scenarios such as database connection failures or authentication service outages. Include instructions for adding new alert rules and testing alert delivery. Address common pitfalls like alert fatigue and misconfigured matchers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Onboarding Automation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the developer onboarding automation using quickstart.sh. Explain how the script streamlines environment setup, dependency installation, and service configuration. Document the automated creation of necessary directories, configuration files, and database initialization. Describe integration with Docker for containerized development environments. Include instructions for customizing the script for different development workflows. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues and how to extend the script with additional setup tasks. Highlight the role of this automation in reducing onboarding time and ensuring consistent development environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Systemd Service Management and Auto-Start
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the systemd service integration used for process management and auto-start on boot. Document the slimyai-web.service unit file created by the deployment script, explaining its configuration parameters including After, Requires, and RemainAfterExit directives. Describe the ExecStart and ExecStop commands that control the Docker Compose lifecycle. Explain how systemctl daemon-reload and enable commands integrate the service into the system startup sequence. Cover the relationship between Docker Compose and systemd, including restart policies and failure handling. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common systemd service issues and demonstrate how to monitor service status using journalctl. Include best practices for production service management and recovery scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the UI architecture and component organization. Explain the AppShell component that provides the authenticated application chrome with conditional header, footer, and chat bar rendering. Describe the layout system with global layout and section-specific layouts. Detail the responsive design implementation using Tailwind CSS classes and density modes. Document the UI component library structure and reusable components in the components directory. Include the theming system and CSS customization approach using globals.css and density-specific stylesheets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing and Page Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the routing and page structure of the admin-ui application. Explain the legacy pages directory routing system and dynamic route implementation for guild-specific pages. Document the page hierarchy and navigation patterns between different administrative sections. Describe the data fetching patterns used in page components and how route parameters are handled. Include examples of route-based code splitting and lazy loading implementations. Address the differences between static and dynamic routes in the context of this React application and how they integrate with the overall application state.

wiki_catalogs.name: User and Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for User and Session entities. Detail the field definitions, authentication-related constraints, and expiration mechanisms for sessions. Document the methods for user lookup by Discord ID, session creation with token-based authentication, and session validation with user inclusion. Explain the cleanup procedures for expired sessions and user session invalidation. Include examples of secure session management patterns, token handling, and protection against session fixation attacks. Address performance considerations for session lookups and the impact of foreign key relationships on query performance. Document the data retention policy for expired sessions and audit implications of session operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: UsageDiagnosticsCard
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the UsageDiagnosticsCard component in the admin-ui application. Explain its purpose in visualizing usage analytics and thresholds for guilds, including metrics like message volume, API calls, and processing limits. Document component props, data formatting methods, and integration with the admin-api usage endpoints. Include usage examples from the guild diagnostics dashboard, describe visual indicators for threshold breaches and historical trends. Address responsive design for different screen sizes, accessibility considerations for color-coded data, and extensibility for additional metrics.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chat Service Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the chat service endpoints in the admin-api service. Document the GET /api/chat/:guildId/history endpoint for retrieving chat history with parameters for message limit and access control rules based on user roles. Detail the POST /api/chat/messages endpoint for submitting new messages to conversations, including validation of message content and conversation IDs. Explain the WebSocket-based real-time communication architecture and message persistence mechanism. Include information about conversation management endpoints for creating, listing, retrieving, and deleting conversations with associated metadata. Document the personality mode feature and its impact on message processing. Specify request/response schemas with example payloads for both REST and WebSocket interactions. Explain the job queuing system for message processing, rate limiting policies to prevent spam, and moderation features. Provide usage examples for common chat interactions and integration patterns with the web application's chat interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Personality Mode Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the personality mode feature in the chat service. Explain how personality modes are configured at the guild and conversation levels, including the available personality types and their behavioral characteristics. Document the API endpoints that manage personality settings, such as GET /api/chat/personality for retrieving available modes and POST /api/chat/conversations/:id/personality for updating conversation-specific settings. Describe the integration between the personality configuration and message processing pipeline, where mode selection influences AI response generation and bot behavior. Specify the data structure used for personality definitions, including tone, response style, and capability flags. Provide examples of how different personality modes affect conversation flow and user experience. Include information on permission requirements for changing personality settings and audit logging of configuration changes. Address performance implications of complex personality processing and caching strategies for frequently used configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Delete Guild Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the DELETE /api/guilds/:id endpoint. Explain its purpose in removing a guild's configuration from the system, including cleanup of related settings, sessions, and cached data. Specify the ':id' parameter validation and pre-deletion checks to ensure the requesting user has ownership or administrative rights. Describe the cascade effects including deletion of associated records in guild-settings, audit logs, and session stores. Document the authentication flow using JWT and RBAC enforcement in middleware. Include example requests and responses, highlighting success (204 No Content) and error cases such as 403 Forbidden or 404 Not Found. Address soft-delete vs hard-delete strategies, data retention policies, and safeguards against accidental deletion. Discuss integration with background jobs for asynchronous cleanup and monitoring via the audit service.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend architecture focused on the admin-api service. Describe the Express.js application structure with middleware layers, routing system, and service modules. Explain the database layer using Prisma ORM with MySQL/PostgreSQL and the migration strategy. Document the authentication flow using Discord OAuth2 and JWT tokens stored in httpOnly cookies. Cover the API endpoint design patterns and request/response handling. Detail the error handling strategy as documented in ERROR_HANDLING.md. Explain the integration between Express routes and business logic in services. Address scalability considerations and security measures including rate limiting and CSRF protection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Logging and Error Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the logging and error handling system. Detail the structured logging format with timestamp, log level, message, and contextual metadata. Explain the four log levels (INFO, WARN, ERROR, DEBUG) and their appropriate usage scenarios. Document the context merging behavior in createLogger and how child loggers inherit default properties. Describe the safeHandler implementation that wraps async functions to catch and log errors while preventing process crashes. Explain automatic context extraction from Discord.js objects (Interactions, Messages, Guilds) and how stack traces are preserved. Cover the planned future enhancements including external logging services, JSON logging, log rotation, and metrics dashboards. Include performance considerations for production logging and strategies for log volume management.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the API integration strategy between frontend applications and the admin-api backend. Describe the API client implementation with error handling, retry logic, and request/response interception. Document the authentication token management and automatic JWT refresh mechanisms. Explain the data transformation patterns between API responses and frontend state. Cover the query parameter serialization and response caching strategies. Include guidelines for handling different HTTP status codes and API rate limiting. Address the differences in API clients between the web and admin-ui applications and their respective use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Handling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the error handling strategy as documented in ERROR_HANDLING.md. Thoroughly explain the implementation of centralized error handling using the apiHandler wrapper function. Document the custom error classes and their hierarchy. Explain the middleware execution order in the API Gateway pattern and how errors propagate through the system. Include examples of error handling in route handlers and asynchronous operations. Address logging strategies for different error types and monitoring integration. Provide guidance on creating new error types and handling edge cases. Document the user-facing error response format and security considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Snail Feature Package
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the shared-snail package focused on snail-related data models, event processing, and timeline features used across web and admin-ui applications. Document its export of snail event schemas, history utilities, and state management interfaces. Explain integration with web/lib/snail-events.ts and admin-ui/components/DiagnosticsCard.jsx for displaying snail diagnostics. Include examples of event ingestion from snail-vision.js, timeline rendering in snail-timeline.tsx, and state synchronization patterns. Address data retention policies, performance optimization for large timelines, and customization options for snail behavior visualization. Provide guidance on extending event types and ensuring consistency between frontend displays and backend processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Logging Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the centralized logging strategy across the Slimy Monorepo. Document the implementation of structured logging using console.log and custom logger wrappers with JSON formatting. Explain log levels (info, warn, error, debug) and their appropriate usage across services. Detail context propagation including request IDs, user IDs, and guild IDs through middleware and service layers. Describe log aggregation patterns and how logs are collected from Docker containers. Explain correlation of logs with Sentry errors and distributed tracing concepts. Include examples from auth middleware, queue processors, and API routes showing contextual logging. Provide best practices for log message formatting, avoiding PII, and performance considerations when logging at scale.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Automation Script
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the deploy-to-server.sh automation script. Break down each section of the script including repository update, admin API status checking, docker-compose configuration, Caddyfile management, and service deployment. Explain the error handling mechanisms using set -e and conditional checks. Document the configuration variables at the top of the script and their purpose in environment customization. Describe the step-by-step deployment process from code update to service activation. Include the testing phase that verifies both direct container access and proxied HTTPS access. Cover the systemd service creation process and its role in ensuring auto-restart after system reboots. Provide examples of script customization for different deployment targets and troubleshooting common deployment failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling and Responsive Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the styling and responsive design approach in the admin-ui application. Document the global CSS architecture and utility class system. Explain the responsive design implementation across different screen sizes and device types. Cover the density-based styling system with compact, force, and ultra density modes. Describe the mobile-first design approach and how layout adapts across breakpoints. Include guidance on extending the styling system with new components and maintaining visual consistency. Address CSS specificity management and performance considerations for large style sheets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Log System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the AuditLog entity and its associated operations. Detail the structure of audit records including action types, resource tracking, and contextual metadata storage. Document the createAuditLog method parameters, success/failure tracking, and error message handling. Explain the query interface for retrieving audit logs with various filters (user, action, resource type, date range). Include examples of audit log usage patterns for security monitoring and compliance reporting. Address performance considerations for high-volume audit logging, indexing strategies for common query patterns, and data retention policies. Document the integration between audit logging and other system components like authentication and guild management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Drawer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Drawer component in the admin-ui application. Explain its role as a primary navigation container for mobile and desktop interfaces, including slide-in behavior and state management. Document component props, open/close controls, and integration with React Router for navigation. Include usage examples from various pages, describe touch gesture support on mobile devices and keyboard accessibility. Address performance considerations for rendering complex content within the drawer and theming options for visual customization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Diagnostics Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the diagnostics endpoints in the admin-api service. Document the GET /api/diag endpoint for system health monitoring, including the response structure with authentication status, server uptime, memory usage, Node.js version, and upload statistics. Explain the purpose of this endpoint in the system's monitoring architecture and its role in the status page functionality. Detail the authentication behavior where unauthenticated requests return limited information while authenticated users receive comprehensive system metrics. Include information about caching strategies in the web application layer with 60-second revalidation. Document request/response schemas with example payloads for both healthy and error states. Explain how network errors are handled and transformed into structured responses with appropriate HTTP status codes. Provide usage examples for system monitoring integrations and troubleshooting connectivity issues between services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Bot Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the bot service focused on the Discord bot implementation. Describe the discord.js integration, event handling system, and command registration process. Explain how the bot communicates with the admin-api for data processing and state management. Document the health monitoring command and error handling strategy. Cover logging implementation and configuration management. Explain the bot's role in the overall ecosystem, including processing Discord events and triggering background jobs. Address deployment considerations and how the bot maintains connection to Discord's gateway.

wiki_catalogs.name: ErrorBoundary
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the ErrorBoundary component in the admin-ui application. Explain its implementation using React's error boundary pattern to gracefully handle runtime errors in child components. Document component lifecycle methods, error state management, and fallback UI rendering. Include usage examples from page-level wrappers, describe integration with error reporting services like Sentry, and explain how user actions are preserved during error recovery. Address limitations of error boundaries and best practices for logging and user communication during failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow Between Layers
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for data flow between layers focused on the Slimy Monorepo. Map the complete data pathways: from Discord events processed by the bot to database storage via admin-api, from user interactions in web applications to API responses, and from background job processing to state updates. Explain the request flow from frontend to backend, including authentication token propagation and CORS handling. Document how real-time data is handled through WebSocket connections and socket.js integration. Illustrate the data processing pipeline for club data ingestion and analytics generation. Include error propagation patterns and how failures are handled across service boundaries. Provide sequence diagrams for key workflows like guild configuration and chat interaction.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Packages
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for shared packages focused on the reusable components across the Slimy Monorepo. Document each shared package: shared-auth for authentication logic, shared-config for configuration management, shared-db for database utilities, shared-codes for code processing functionality, and shared-snail for snail-related features. Explain the versioning strategy and how these packages are consumed by applications in the monorepo. Detail the export interfaces and intended usage patterns for each package. Cover the development workflow for modifying shared packages and testing their impact across dependent services. Address backward compatibility considerations and upgrade procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Job Queue System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the job queue system focused on the BullMQ implementation. Describe the Redis-based queue infrastructure and how jobs are enqueued and processed. Document the different job types: audit-processor, chat-processor, database-processor, and their respective responsibilities. Explain the queue configuration, worker patterns, and error handling for failed jobs. Cover the retry mechanisms and job prioritization strategies. Illustrate how background processing decouples time-consuming operations from request-response cycles. Provide monitoring guidance for queue health and performance metrics. Include code examples showing job creation and processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Monitoring and Observability
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for monitoring and observability focused on the Slimy Monorepo's telemetry system. Document the error tracking implementation with Sentry, including exception capture and context enrichment. Explain the metrics collection using Prometheus with custom metrics for API performance and system health. Describe the Grafana dashboard configuration and key visualizations for system monitoring. Cover the Alertmanager setup for incident notification and alert routing. Detail the logging strategy across services and log aggregation patterns. Include instructions for setting up the monitoring stack in different environments. Provide guidance on interpreting key metrics and diagnosing common issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for environment configuration focused on the Slimy Monorepo's configuration management. Document the environment variable system across all services, including required variables for database connections, authentication, and service coordination. Explain the configuration validation process and error handling for missing or invalid values. Cover the different configuration profiles for development, testing, and production environments. Detail the .env file usage and how configurations are loaded at runtime. Include guidance on securely managing secrets and credentials. Provide examples of configuration files for different deployment scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: CI/CD Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the CI/CD pipeline focused on the automated build and deployment system. Describe the GitHub Actions workflow for continuous integration, including test execution and build validation. Explain the Docker-based build process for each service and image tagging strategy. Document the deployment scripts and their role in production updates. Cover the testing strategy with unit, integration, and end-to-end tests using Playwright. Include the quickstart automation and how it simplifies developer onboarding. Address rollback procedures and deployment verification steps. Provide best practices for contributing to the codebase and navigating the CI/CD process.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the deployment architecture focused on the production environment. Describe the Docker containerization strategy for each service and their network configuration. Explain the docker-compose setup for different environments including production, monitoring, and testing. Document the systemd integration for service management and auto-start on boot. Cover the reverse proxy configuration with Caddy and SSL termination. Include resource allocation considerations and scaling patterns. Address data persistence using Docker volumes and backup strategies. Provide deployment topology diagrams showing service interconnections and external access points.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Onboarding Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the developer onboarding guide focused on getting new developers productive with the Slimy Monorepo. Provide step-by-step setup instructions including installing dependencies with pnpm, configuring environment variables, and starting services. Document the essential commands for development, testing, and building. Explain the project structure and how to navigate the codebase. Cover the testing workflow and how to run different test suites. Include debugging tips and common troubleshooting solutions. Provide guidance on making first contributions and following coding standards. Address common setup issues and their resolutions.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis of slimy-monorepo

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The `slimy-monorepo` is a full-stack monorepo architecture designed to support a suite of interconnected applications centered around a Discord bot ecosystem, administrative interfaces, and public web services. The system appears to manage guild (server) configurations, club data processing, chat interactions, and analytics for a community-driven platform.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide a unified administrative interface for managing Discord guilds and bot functionality
- Enable data ingestion and processing from external sources (e.g., spreadsheets, APIs)
- Support real-time chat interactions through a bot with personality features
- Offer monitoring, diagnostics, and usage tracking capabilities
- Maintain a scalable, maintainable architecture through shared components

### Target Audience
- System administrators managing the bot infrastructure
- Community managers configuring guild-specific settings
- Developers extending the platform's capabilities
- End users interacting with the bot in Discord servers

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a monorepo structure with multiple distinct applications and shared packages:

```mermaid
graph TD
  SharedLib[Shared Libraries] --> AdminAPI
  SharedLib --> WebApp
  SharedLib --> AdminUI
  SharedLib --> Bot
  AdminAPI --> Database[(Prisma/MySQL)]
  AdminAPI --> Redis[(Redis Cache)]
  WebApp --> AdminAPI
  WebApp --> Database
  WebApp --> Redis
  AdminUI --> AdminAPI
  Bot --> DiscordAPI
  Bot --> AdminAPI
  Monitoring[Monitoring Stack] --> AdminAPI
  Monitoring --> WebApp

  subgraph "Applications"
    AdminAPI[admin-api]
    WebApp[web]
    AdminUI[admin-ui]
    Bot[bot]
  end

  subgraph "Shared Packages"
    SharedLib
    SharedAuth[shared-auth]
    SharedConfig[shared-config]
    SharedDB[shared-db]
    SharedCodes[shared-codes]
    SharedSnail[shared-snail]
  end
```

### Design Patterns
The architecture employs several key design patterns:
- **Monorepo Organization**: Using pnpm workspaces to manage multiple packages
- **API Gateway Pattern**: The admin-api serves as a central backend service
- **Micro-Frontends**: Separate UI applications (admin-ui, web) serving different user needs
- **Shared Libraries**: Common functionality extracted into reusable packages
- **Layered Architecture**: Clear separation between routes, middleware, services, and data access

### System Relationships
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  Client -->|HTTP| WebApp
  Client -->|HTTP| AdminUI
  AdminUI -->|API Calls| AdminAPI
  WebApp -->|API Calls| AdminAPI
  AdminAPI -->|Database Queries| Database
  AdminAPI -->|Cache Operations| Redis
  Bot -->|WebSocket| DiscordAPI
  Bot -->|HTTP| AdminAPI
  AdminAPI -->|Background Jobs| Queue[BullMQ]
  
  Database[(Prisma/MySQL)]
  Redis[(Redis)]
  Queue[(BullMQ)]
```

### Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart LR
  ExternalSource -->|Data Ingest| AdminAPI
  AdminAPI -->|Process & Store| Database
  Database -->|Retrieve| AdminAPI
  AdminAPI -->|Serve API| WebApp
  AdminAPI -->|Serve API| AdminUI
  WebApp -->|User Interaction| Client
  AdminUI -->|Admin Actions| Client
  Bot -->|Real-time Events| DiscordAPI
  DiscordAPI -->|Messages| Bot
  Bot -->|Process| AdminAPI
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Backend API**: `/apps/admin-api/server.js` - Express server entry point
- **Web Application**: `/apps/web/app/page.tsx` - Next.js application root
- **Admin UI**: `/apps/admin-ui/pages/index.js` - Admin interface entry
- **Bot Service**: `/apps/bot/src/index.ts` - Discord bot initialization

### Core Modules
- **Authentication**: JWT-based auth system with middleware in `/apps/admin-api/src/middleware/auth.js`
- **Database Access**: Prisma ORM with migrations in `/apps/admin-api/prisma/migrations/`
- **Queue Processing**: BullMQ for background jobs in `/apps/admin-api/src/lib/queues/`
- **API Routes**: RESTful endpoints in `/apps/admin-api/src/routes/` and Next.js API routes in `/apps/web/app/api/`

### Configuration Approach
The project uses environment-based configuration with validation:

```mermaid
graph TD
  EnvFile[.env files] --> ConfigModule
  PackageJSON[npm scripts] --> ConfigModule
  Docker[Docker environment] --> ConfigModule
  ConfigModule --> AdminAPI
  ConfigModule --> WebApp
  ConfigModule --> Bot
  
  subgraph "Configuration"
    ConfigModule[Configuration Manager]
    Validation[env-validation.js]
    Constants[config.js]
  end
```

Key configuration files:
- `/apps/admin-api/src/lib/config/index.js` - Configuration management
- `/apps/admin-api/jest.config.js` - Testing configuration
- `/apps/web/next.config.js` - Next.js build configuration
- `/apps/web/tailwind.config.ts` - Styling configuration

### External Dependencies
The project leverages numerous modern JavaScript libraries:

**Backend (admin-api):**
- Express.js for web server
- Prisma for database ORM
- BullMQ for job queuing
- Sentry for error tracking
- ioredis for Redis operations

**Web Application:**
- Next.js 16 for React framework
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Prisma for database access
- OpenAI SDK for AI features

**Bot:**
- discord.js for Discord API integration

**Testing:**
- Jest for admin-api testing
- Vitest for web application testing
- Playwright for E2E testing

### Integration Points
```mermaid
graph LR
  DiscordAPI --> Bot
  Bot --> AdminAPI
  AdminAPI --> ExternalAPIs
  WebApp --> AdminAPI
  AdminUI --> AdminAPI
  Monitoring --> AllServices
  
  subgraph "External Services"
    DiscordAPI[Discord API]
    ExternalAPIs[Reddit, PocketGamer, etc.]
    Monitoring[Grafana/Prometheus]
  end
  
  subgraph "Internal Services"
    AdminAPI
    WebApp
    AdminUI
    Bot
  end
```

Key integration files:
- `/apps/web/lib/adapters/` - External service adapters
- `/apps/admin-api/src/services/oauth.js` - OAuth integration
- `/apps/admin-api/lib/club-sheets.js` - Google Sheets integration
- `/apps/web/lib/chat/openai.ts` - OpenAI API integration

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The system provides several core features:

1. **Guild Management**: Configuration and monitoring of Discord servers
2. **Club Data Processing**: Ingestion and analysis of club information from spreadsheets
3. **Chat Intelligence**: Bot with personality and response capabilities
4. **Usage Analytics**: Tracking and reporting of system usage
5. **Administrative Diagnostics**: Monitoring and troubleshooting tools

### Implementation Highlights

#### Authentication Flow
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> RequestReceived
  RequestReceived --> AuthCheck: Incoming Request
  AuthCheck --> ExtractToken: Has Authorization Header
  AuthCheck --> PublicRoute: Is Public Endpoint
  ExtractToken --> ValidateToken: Verify JWT
  ValidateToken --> Authenticated: Valid Token
  ValidateToken --> Unauthorized: Invalid Token
  Authenticated --> ProcessRequest: Continue to Route
  PublicRoute --> ProcessRequest
  ProcessRequest --> SendResponse
  SendResponse --> [*]
```

The authentication system is implemented in:
- `/apps/admin-api/src/middleware/auth.js` - JWT authentication middleware
- `/apps/admin-api/lib/jwt.js` - Token generation and verification
- `/apps/admin-api/src/routes/auth.js` - Authentication endpoints

#### Data Processing Pipeline
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  Source[Data Source] --> Ingest[Ingest Module]
  Ingest --> Validate[Validation]
  Validate --> Transform[Transformation]
  Transform --> Store[Database Storage]
  Store --> Process[Background Processing]
  Process --> Enrich[Data Enrichment]
  Enrich --> Analyze[Analytics Generation]
  Analyze --> Serve[API Exposure]
  
  subgraph "Club Data Pipeline"
    Ingest[club-ingest.js]
    Validate[schemas.js]
    Transform[club-corrections.js]
    Store[Prisma]
    Process[queue-manager.js]
    Enrich[club-vision.js]
    Analyze[stats-tracker.js]
  end
```

Key implementation files:
- `/apps/admin-api/lib/club-ingest.js` - Data ingestion
- `/apps/admin-api/lib/club-corrections.js` - Data correction
- `/apps/admin-api/lib/club-vision.js` - Vision API integration
- `/apps/admin-api/src/lib/validation/schemas.js` - Data validation

#### Real-time Communication
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
  User->>+WebApp: Send Message
  WebApp->>+AdminAPI: API Request
  AdminAPI->>+Queue: Add to Processing Queue
  Queue-->>-AdminAPI: Acknowledged
  AdminAPI-->>-WebApp: Immediate Response
  loop Worker Processing
    Queue->>+Worker: Retrieve Job
    Worker->>+ExternalAPI: Enrich Data
    ExternalAPI-->>-Worker: Response
    Worker->>+Database: Update Records
    Database-->>-Worker: Confirmation
    Worker->>+WebApp: Push Update
  end
```

Real-time features are implemented in:
- `/apps/admin-api/src/socket.js` - WebSocket server
- `/apps/admin-api/src/lib/queues/` - Background job processors
- `/apps/web/lib/hooks/use-chat.ts` - Client-side chat handling

Sources:
- [package.json](/home/slimy/.qoder-server/slimy-monorepo/apps/admin-api/package.json)
- [package.json](/home/slimy/.qoder-server/slimy-monorepo/apps/web/package.json)
- [package.json](/home/slimy/.qoder-server/slimy-monorepo/apps/bot/package.json)
- [pnpm-workspace.yaml](/home/slimy/.qoder-server/slimy-monorepo/pnpm-workspace.yaml)
- [app.js](/home/slimy/.qoder-server/slimy-monorepo/apps/admin-api/src/app.js)
</blog>
